simplified: Your dreams can show you things that are on your mind, even if you didn't know it. Some common dreams, like flying or falling, might mean the same thing for many people. But to understand what they mean to you, think about what happened in your daily life and how you felt.

Moscow has many wild dogs living in the city. There are about 35,000 dogs on the streets. Some dogs were born there, while others used to be pets but their owners left them. Some dogs live alone and some live with friends. Scientists studied the dogs in 2010. They found that the dogs have learned to survive well in the city. The dogs know it's safer to cross the street when people are around. Some dogs even understand traffic lights!

Wonder is a book by RJ Palacio. She says that she got the idea for the book when she saw a girl with a special face on the street one day. Wonder is very popular in America and has won many awards. Many schools use it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. There will be a movie version soon!

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. People often think rats are not good pets. But Chloe knows they're nice if you take care of them well. She's tried to tell people, but some don't believe her. They might be scared because they don't know much about rats. Chloe didn't like rats at first either. Her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how cute and smart they were. Then, one of Martin's rats had babies. Chloe decided she wanted two of them.

Cape Town can be a difficult place for monkeys. Some have been hurt or killed in car accidents. Others have gotten shocked when playing with electricity cables. Monkeys are very rare and we need to help them. The city council has hired people called Baboon Monitors. Their job is to move the monkeys away from the city or catch them and take them back to the countryside. This plan has worked a little bit, but it's hard to keep the monkeys from coming back to the city because they think it's an easy place to find food.

I work for a big IT company that is based in America. Because of this, I do my job from home using my computer. This means I don't have to travel to work or talk to colleagues just for fun. I work on specific projects and like the flexibility because it's easy to take time off when my kids need me at school events or doctor appointments. The only problem is that without a set schedule, I often work late into the evening and might even skip dinner to finish something important.

In the 1990s, people kept doing graffiti. But there was also a big increase in street art all around the world. Some artists wanted to say something important about war, unfairness and not treating everyone equally. They made art that tried to make people think about these things. Other artists just wanted to create nice-looking art. In South America, many artists went to poor areas and added color, life and beauty to grey city walls.

People see many things they can buy every day. This is because of social media, magazines, and shop windows. British people are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. It's easy to buy online without thinking too much. Big brands sell cheap clothes that you can wear a few times and then throw away.

Sam looked up at the big cloud of dust from the car coming to the Big House. The horses were moving around, swatting at flies with their tails. They didn't care that Mr Carter was visiting after a long time. Sam waited. Mr Carter only comes out here when he has to. That's okay with Sam. He likes to stay out of his boss's way so he can keep his job. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt had wet spots like maps on an atlas. His skin was getting red in the sun. He looks healthy because he works and makes money while others do the work.

Some people who live in Berlin don't like when hunters shoot pigs. They think it's too mean. Hunters and animal lovers argue about this. The city council listened to their complaints. Instead of shooting, they put up fences around the pigs' homes. It's now against the rules to give them food. We'll see if this helps. Maybe it won't work because winters are getting warmer and there are more pigs than before.

Suzanne wrote the Hunger Games book because she loves ancient Greek stories. When she was little, one of her favorite stories was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens is controlled by Crete. The people of Athens are unhappy, so they rebel. As punishment, the king of Crete makes them send 14 young boys and girls to Crete every year. These kids go into a big maze called the Labyrinth and are eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one brave boy named Theseus fights the Minotaur and defeats it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a strong hero like Theseus, but in the future.

Zoos bring people and animals together. This helps us learn about taking care of animals and their homes. Some zoos take in animals that were not treated well, like those from circuses or pets that were left behind. Zoos also do important research on how animals behave and how to make them feel better when they are sick.

There's a new way to think about buying things. It's called 'buy nothing'. This idea started in Canada many years ago. Then it went to America, where people got tired of spending too much money on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day, people do different kinds of protests. Some people even cut up their credit cards! Throughout the year, groups that follow this idea help each other by exchanging or fixing things they already have.

Is graffiti good art or bad? It depends on how you think. Some people think it is okay to write or paint on walls, but many countries say it is not allowed. If you do it, the police might stop you and you might have to pay money. City officials are unhappy because cleaning up graffiti costs a lot of money.

What do people think about graffiti and street art? Many people now see how important it is as a type of art. Big shows of street art have been held in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. A famous American artist named Elura Emerald showed her own street art at a gallery in New York City in 2008. She said that artists who paint on the streets are just being themselves and not causing any harm. We should appreciate and praise them.

Most people have dreams every night. They can have up to six dreams each night after they are 10 years old. That's a lot! In one year, someone might have 2,000 dreams. By the time they are 80 years old, that person might have had 140,000 dreams. But we often forget our dreams. Even so, some people remember a few thousand of their dreams over their lifetime. It's not hard to believe that sometimes what happens in a dream can happen in real life too.

The Hunger Games happens in the future. North America was damaged, so people moved away. The country is called Panem. It has 12 poor areas controlled by a rich city called Capitol. Capitol has all the power. Each area makes different things for Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, gives coal to everyone. A long time ago, there were 13 districts. But one district didn't like Capitol and rebelled. Capitol got angry and destroyed it.

Wild animals sometimes come to cities looking for food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are coming into neighborhoods near the city to eat. They open trash cans and take fruit from gardens and orchards. Some brave baboons even go inside people's homes and take food from the kitchen! Baboons can be mean and have hurt many pet animals. Many city residents don't like them being there.

Many accidents happen when building bridges. These accidents often happen because of a mistake made by the people designing the bridge. They might make a wrong calculation. The bridge falls down, and this can be very dangerous for the workers who are on it.

George Lucas was a famous film director. He used an old idea called 'The Hero's Journey' for one of his movies. The story usually starts with someone living a normal life, but then something happens that makes them go on an adventure. This changes their life forever. In the movie Star Wars, Luke lives with his aunt and uncle. They fix robots together. One day, he finds a message from Princess Leia inside a robot named R2D2. This is when Luke's adventure starts.

One way to stop a big rock from hitting Earth is to blow it up with a special bomb. This might sound like something from a movie, but it's an idea that NASA has thought about. They want to use big rockets to hit the rock and change its path. If the rock is too close to Earth, they would put a nuclear bomb on the rocket to make sure it doesn't hit us.

Campbell says that heroes don't want to go on an adventure at first. But then someone helps them, and they decide to start their journey. This person is like a guide or teacher. The next part of the story is when the hero tries to get through some challenges. They might fight against bad people or meet new friends who help them. The hero needs to be ready for the biggest challenge. For Luke Skywalker, his guide is Obi-Wan Kenobi. His friends are Han Solo and two robots named R2D2 and C3PO. The bad person he has to face is Darth Vader inside a big space station called the Death Star.

Some things might seem useless to us, but they can be useful to others. The internet has helped people share these things and make money from it. There are websites and social media groups where we can buy and sell old things. This makes it easy for people to share with each other. We call this the sharing economy.

A long time ago, people thought about dreams in two ways. One idea was that our dreams show us things we don't know or remember. Freud said that if we understand our dreams, we can learn more about how we feel and why we have problems. But some people believed the opposite. They thought that dreams are just a mix of random thoughts in our brain while it's remembering what happened during the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these thoughts and feelings and turn them into a story.

I am my own boss as a freelancer. This is good because I can decide what I do and how I use my time. At first, I worked from home. But it was hard to focus because there were too many distractions. My house needed cleaning, I wanted another cup of tea, and my family wanted my attention. So, I started going to a café nearby to work. The Wi-Fi wasn't great, and I drank too much coffee! In the end, I decided to rent a desk in an office with other freelancers like me. I liked getting dressed for work and focusing on my tasks.

NASA wants to find small and medium-sized asteroids in space. They need money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope uses infrared light to spot asteroids. If they get the money, it might take them 10 years to finish the job. After that, scientists would have to figure out how to protect Earth from really big and dangerous asteroids.

Some people on social media are sharing a new idea. They say don't buy anything! Some famous YouTubers tell their viewers not to spend money for a whole year. Two friends in Canada tried this too. They didn't buy clothes, food, or things for their house for three months. Then they stopped using services like haircuts and eating out. After one year, they had saved $55,000!

Pi likes religion. His family is Hindu, but he wants to know more about other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi says he believes in all three religions - Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one, Pi says 'I want to love God'. They let him decide what he wants to believe.

Some people think writing down your ideas can help you have better dreams. Lucid dreaming means knowing when you're dreaming and being able to control what happens in your dream. This could be helpful if you have a bad dream - you could make it feel safe again. Or, you could decide what happens next, like a movie director. Instead of just trying to understand your dreams, you would be creating them yourself. But maybe you still want some dreams that help you figure out what's on your mind!

People might not know they're part of a big problem with old clothes. They give their unwanted clothes to charity shops. But these shops can't sell all those clothes. Fast fashion is cheap and trendy, but it goes out of style quickly. It's often too bad quality to fix or reuse. People don't want to buy old clothes. Many old clothes get thrown away. Some are sent to other countries, causing more problems for the environment and economy.

Some people like to go on big adventures. Meagan McGrath from Canada is one of them. She has done many exciting things. She climbed the highest mountains in different parts of the world, rode a bike across Canada, and ran a long race in hot weather in the Sahara Desert. But her most amazing trip was when she went skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many people would have stopped then, but Meagan decided to keep going. She pulled a sledge with a tent and food for 40 days through cold weather and snowstorms until she reached the South Pole.

Blek le Rat started painting rats on walls in Paris, where he lives. Now, he wants people to think about important social issues. He paints pictures of homeless people in big cities to help people understand that there's a problem with homelessness.

Some places have special areas for artists to paint. This helps them not to paint on just any wall. In Taiwan, there are special zones where artists can paint and write freely. They can do this without getting in trouble. In Brazil, some cities even let certain artists paint on the subway trains.

Faith47 comes from Cape Town in South Africa. She makes big, colorful pictures of people and animals. She likes to go to different places and find new spots to paint. Her paintings are on streets, old factories, and even cars that nobody uses anymore. Faith47 likes that her art doesn't last forever. It gets washed away or cleaned up soon. This is like how life changes all the time - things end and then start again.

Gabriela used to work in a place where people respected those in charge. Leaders made big decisions and weren't often questioned. But her new team in Sweden works differently. They make decisions together with their bosses. Bosses here are like coaches who want people to think for themselves and expect questions.

Gabriela noticed that she and her team were very different. She wanted to talk to them about this. They said they didn't like being told what to do all the time. They liked having more freedom to make their own decisions. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt like she didn't trust them. They explained that when they tried to change her mind or suggest something new, it was because that's how they always worked.

Os Gêmeos are two brothers from Brazil. They like to paint things. Sometimes they paint small pictures on walls. Other times, they make big, colorful paintings of people on buildings. These paintings can be so big that they need machines to help them finish.

People have been writing on walls for a long time. In old times, people in Africa and Europe drew pictures of animals and people on cave walls. On old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq, we can still see drawings that people made a long time ago. In an old town called Pompeii, archaeologists found many writings on the walls. These writings are in Latin and say things like 'I love you', 'Don't forget me', and even some magic spells!

Have you ever thought about climbing a big mountain or walking across a long distance? Many people do this every year. They want to explore new places and see amazing things. Today, they use special tools like GPS and phones that can talk to satellites. Some people love nature and go on adventures to help protect the environment. Others want to help others and raise money for good causes.

The first test is called DART. It's a special mission to hit an asteroid's moon. The moon, called Didymoon, is 150 meters wide. It goes around its big mother, which is 800 meters wide. If everything goes well, the impact will make Didymoon fall out of orbit. Then, people on Earth can see it with their telescopes.

Katniss Everdeen is the main character of the story. She's 16 years old. Her dad died in an accident at the mine, so she has to help her family by finding food. Katniss goes hunting with her friend Gale in the woods near their home. She gets very good at using a bow and arrow. Katniss's little sister Prim is chosen to be one of the special people who have to fight in an arena on TV. But Katniss says she'll go instead of Prim. The other person from District 12, where they live, is a boy named Peeta. Katniss starts having feelings for him, but it's all very complicated.

Write about your dreams. This will help you remember more details. Think about who was there and where it happened. These things might make the dream's meaning clearer. After a week, you'll be surprised at how much you've written down. Now, you can start to connect your dreams to what happens in your daily life and how you feel.

Long ago, most bridges were made of wood. They were easy to damage in fires. Old train bridges were especially prone to catching on fire. This happened when the wheels and tracks touched and created a spark. Sometimes, this would cause the whole bridge to burn down.

Street art might change in the future, but some things are happening now. Most artists who do street art are young people who paint in their city or town. Some artists travel and work all over the world. They also use the internet to talk to each other and show pictures of their art. The art world is starting to see street art as a real kind of art. We don't know what will happen, but we can be sure that street art is here to stay!

Suzanne Collines doesn't like watching TV shows about wars. When she was little, her dad was a pilot in the US Air Force and he went to Vietnam. Her mom tried to hide the truth from her, but Suzanne still saw news about the war on TV. She knew her dad was there, and it was very scary for her.

A big company called PwC asked many people questions. They wanted to know what people think about working. Over 40,000 people answered. Some people were born between 1983 and 1993 (these are millennials). Others weren't millennials. The questions were about things like how people work together, how they get paid, and how they balance their work and personal life.

Erik Weihenmayer is a brave person from America. He has done many exciting things. He rode his bike in Morocco, went kayaking in the Grand Canyon and climbed Mount Everest. This is amazing because Erik can't see. He's been blind since he was 13 years old. Besides traveling, Erik helps people with disabilities to be active and healthy. He also takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips.

Online shops help people make a little money. For example, busy parents used to not bother selling old toys and clothes from their kids. But now they can sell them online. This way, they can get some extra cash.

Pi and Richard Parker are on a boat for 227 days. They face many challenges like not having enough food, getting sick, and being very tired. They also have to deal with strong storms and hot sunshine. But they manage to stay alive. Sometimes Pi feels better when he thinks about his three religions. Other times, he feels lonely and sad. Then, one day, the coast of Mexico appears on the horizon. That's a big change! I won't tell you what happens next. You'll have to read the book to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they see land.

Chloe came home from school. She made a cup of coffee and took it to her bedroom. She had some homework, but she didn't need to do it right away. She wanted to relax for a little while before her parents got home. This time of day is nice because the house is quiet. She can play with her pet rats then too.

In 2010, NASA looked at big rocks in space near Earth. They found and wrote down 90% of the ones that are as wide as a mountain. These 'near-Earth objects' are things that are close to our planet's path around the sun. There are about 50 more that they need to look at. NASA says none of the 887 big rocks they know about are going to hurt Earth.

Auggie decides to go to school. He's very nervous on his first day. Like other kids who start a new school, he doesn't know what will happen. Because of how he looks, it's a really hard experience. Nobody wants to sit next to him and some kids stare at him or talk about him behind their hands. But then Auggie meets two friends, Jack and Summer. They make him feel better. It's not just the first day that's tough. Auggie learns that his classmates don't want to touch him because they're afraid of getting sick. He has many good days and bad days throughout the school year. Then something big happens at a school camp that changes everything.

Two men looked north. The land went on forever. You couldn't see the fences from where they were standing. Even if a teenager was very bored or unhappy, it's hard to run away on foot. Sam looked at the biggest horse. It was kicking its hooves on the ground. Can the boy ride? he thought. There could be big trouble for someone who knows how to ride horses and is far from help. But there might also be trouble for someone who doesn't know about horses and wants to get away from his father.

Many people have climbed to the top of Mount Everest. They were between 13 and 80 years old. Climbing high mountains can be very dangerous because it's cold and there are strong storms. Now, the best climbers look for new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria loves climbing mountains. She started when she was a teenager. After school, she worked as a nurse, but still climbed in her free time.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest. Then, she decided to climb all 14 mountains that are very high. She doesn't use special machines with oxygen when she climbs. This is a bit scary because it can be hard for people to think and move well at high altitudes. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to help poor children and orphans in Nepal.

We look around our homes and see things we have bought. We might notice some things are not being used. For example, a thick coat for cold weather when it's hot where we live. Or a phone that's old now because we got a new one. Maybe a car that only gets driven on weekends. Or a spare room in our house that is now just for storing things.

Dreams have been important for a long time. People thought dreams were special messages from above. They believed these messages could tell us something new or help us understand things better. Even now, many people remember having a dream about someone or something and then it happened in real life later on.

Some big projects involve building bridges. These bridges are very important because they help cars, trucks, and trains cross rivers, mountains, or other roads. Because of this, people pay close attention to them. If a bridge breaks, it's especially serious.

Gabriela was very frustrated for weeks. She sent an email to her boss in Sweden about problems with her team. Her boss just asked two questions: 'Is your team still doing well?' and 'What can you do to work better with your team members?' Gabriela didn't like the way her boss answered.

Some dogs live together in groups. They know that people like to give food to small and cute dogs. So, these dogs go out to ask for food for their whole group. Some dogs are even clever enough to use the city's train system! Scientists don't know exactly how they do it, but one idea is that they smell where they want to go. Another idea is that they learn the names of stations from announcements on the train. Either way, people who take the train have gotten used to seeing dogs on the trains and hardly notice them anymore.

Ed Stafford from England walked all the way along the Amazon River. He started near some small mountains in Peru and finished at the river's end in Brazil, after two years and four months. He walked 6,000 kilometers! The Amazon is a very dangerous place because there are snakes, crocodiles, and big cats like jaguars. But Ed was okay. He just got bitten by mosquitoes and ants a few thousand times.

In the UK, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about 4% of their money. It might not seem like much, but there are two big problems. First, many people buy things using credit cards. On average, adults owe around £670 to these companies. That's a lot! Second, people are buying things they don't need and can't afford. This is bad for the environment too. Each year, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes. Most of it goes into landfills.

Ed couldn't have walked through the rainforest without technology. He used a radio to ask people for food and permission to cross their land. Many people came to meet him and helped him find his way through the hard terrain. Ed wrote about his journey on his blog every day. He used the attention from the media to tell people about the problems with the rainforest and raise money for good causes in Brazil and Peru, like helping children and protecting the environment.

Many businesses are now using the sharing economy to make money. They're finding ways to use things that aren't being used very much. One way they do this is by creating a website where people can find what they need or offer something they have. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their homes or rooms to tourists. This makes them some extra money. Another company like Uber lets people use their own cars to drive others around and earn some cash on the side.

Zoos help endangered animals by breeding them in special programs. Some animals in the wild have trouble finding friends and having babies because there are too few of them or they don't have a safe place to live. Zoos give these animals a safe home where they can live and have babies. This is important because some animal populations are getting smaller and might become too similar if they only breed with each other. The breeding programs help by releasing zoo-born animals back into the wild, which makes the population more diverse.

Boat and train accidents are very rare. But sometimes they can make a bridge fall down. This happens for different reasons. With trains, it's how fast they hit the bridge that makes it fall. With boats, it's because they are very heavy. Even if they're going slowly, this can still happen. The best way to stop bridges from falling is to plan ahead. We have new technologies that can find weak spots in bridges. This helps us make safer places for workers and design better bridges. All of these things can help reduce the number of accidents like this.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals on the boat. He jumps into the water to get away from them. But then he remembers that there are big sharks in the ocean and thinks, 'Oh no! I have to get back on the boat!' One by one, the animals on the boat start eating each other until only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger is feeling sick and doesn't want to eat him right away.

Pi was 16 when there was a new government. His parents didn't like it. They were worried about the future. So, they decided to close their zoo and move to Canada. Some animals went to other zoos in North America. Pi's family took some animals with them on a big boat to Canada. But then, a really bad storm came. The boat sank! Unfortunately, Pi's family and all the sailors died. But Pi was okay. He was on a small boat with a hyena, zebra, orangutan, and a huge tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young people written by Suzanne Collins from America. Many people have read it since it was published in 2008. It has been translated into many languages - 26! And millions of copies have been sold all around the world. This book is special because it's the first one to sell over a million electronic copies. Now, The Hunger Games is also a big movie and it's very successful too. When it opened in North America, it made $152.5 million dollars just on its first weekend!

Dreams might be what happens when our brains put together all the things we think about during the day. But in dreams, these thoughts are like pictures with special meanings. When we're awake, our thoughts are like words in our head. We have conversations with ourselves. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that helps us talk doesn't work as well. The part that makes us feel emotions becomes stronger.

Being happy often means having good friendships and family relationships. Many happy people have close friends and family members they see regularly. It's also important to have one special person you can talk to about your feelings - this is called 'self-disclosure'. You don't need lots of friends, just a few close ones. Having someone to really talk to is very important. Some people need to learn how to listen well to others to make their relationships stronger.

Carol Dweck is a psychologist who talks about how our brains can change. She says that we can learn new things even if we're not good at them at first. Many people praise others for their natural talents, like 'You're really good at this!' or 'You have a talent for that!'. But research shows that praising the way someone does something - like trying hard, experimenting and solving problems - helps us learn new skills and get better at things.

The rover looks at the air around it sometimes. In 2014, it found something important in the air on Mars. It was methane, a type of gas that is part of natural gas. Methane doesn't last very long - just a few hundred years. This means that something on Mars is making more methane. NASA says that Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at one time. The amount of methane goes up and down during the year, like a planet is breathing.

A long time ago, a psychologist named Carol Dweck gave some problems to 10-year-old kids. The problems were a little too hard for them. Some kids liked the challenge and thought they could get better at it. They wanted to do well in the future. These kids had a special way of thinking - they believed they could improve. But other kids felt bad because they didn't think they did well enough. They thought their brains were being tested and they failed. They couldn't imagine getting better. Some of these kids might try to cheat next time. Others looked for someone who did worse than them so they would feel a little better.

Horror movies like to use empty places. This could be a hospital with nobody inside, an old house with no one living there, or a town where everyone has gone away. There's something special about quiet, empty spaces. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also because these places are very quiet and that can be scary too.

Basements in scary movies are always frightening. Something bad might be hiding or someone evil has hidden something. Basements are usually dark and a bit wet. You can only get to them by going down some narrow stairs. Even if nothing is there, basements still feel creepy.

Gary Collins was a policeman who wasn't working. He watched TV and saw people rioting in London. He knew some of them and decided to come back from his holiday to help figure out who they were. It took him six months, but he looked at lots of video footage and found 190 people. Most of the time, he just used their eyes to identify them. His help was very important for solving the mystery. Even with a lot of video (200,000 hours!), special computer software only found one person.

I think it's really interesting to think about how we can make ourselves better. What if we could put a computer in our brain? It will be possible soon, and it will help us do things like remember better, see and hear more clearly, and do math problems easily. This idea is going to become normal.

The talk was really interesting. The speaker said some true things. For example, think about parents. If they use their phones when they're cooking or waiting for the traffic light to turn green, why can't teenagers do the same? They might be doing their homework and still want to text. She also talked about people wanting to be in two places at once. So, they switch between talking online and talking in real life. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet up, but then each one talks to someone else online instead of talking to the others.

The news can make us think the world is getting more violent. But there's also good news. Between World War II and 1990, there were many wars that hurt a lot of people. Now, countries are mostly living in peace with each other. However, terrorism has increased recently. Wars have killed many civilians since World War II. Despite this, the numbers aren't all bad. It's more likely for someone to be killed by violent crime than war. But the number of murders per 100,000 people went down from 8 in 2000 to around 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia helps people's rights. She has seen many projects that help women and girls in her country, Bangladesh. But sometimes these projects stop and leave nothing behind. Wasfia thought about this. She wanted to make a change. She combined two things she loves: climbing mountains and helping people. This is because most people in Bangladesh have never seen a mountain before. They live near the sea and the land is flat. Wasfia started climbing while working on projects to help people in Tibet and Nepal. Now, her campaign is making a difference. People in Bangladesh are starting to listen and so is the rest of the world.

Most people think that poor countries are very bad off. They think there is lots of poverty, mean leaders, and no chance for things to get better. But this isn't true! Something amazing is happening. In the last 20 years, over 700 million people have become richer and stopped being poor. Also, every year, 6 million fewer children die from sickness. More girls are going to school now, and many more people have clean water.

Some managers try to make their feedback more helpful by saying nice things first, then a not-so-nice thing, and finally another nice thing. But when this happens all the time, employees start to think that the nice comments are just trying to hide the bad news. This makes the nice comments less important. Instead, we should say nice things because they help people do better.

I'm part of a group called Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. Don't think of robots like in movies, where they're scary and bad. Right now, some military machines are being used to hurt people without much human control. They're things like drones, gun turrets, and small robots that can shoot. If we let them get even more powerful, we'll have 'killer robots' that decide who to kill on their own. I think this would be very wrong and bad for humans. We should be careful about what we ask machines to do.

Many people learn English. It's the most popular language in the world. But Chinese has more native speakers than any other language. There isn't a clear connection between how many people speak a language and how many people want to learn it. However, there is a link between how many people want to learn a language and how many countries use that language.

Your boss stops you and wants to talk about your work on the project. You worry about it all weekend. What did I do wrong? On Monday morning, you go to her office. She starts by saying nice things about your work. You wonder if this is just a way to start giving feedback. You know how this usually goes: say something good, then tell me what's not so good, and finally say something good again.

This rock music album, Born in the USA, has fast-paced songs that make you want to tap your feet. But behind these catchy tunes are stories about people's problems. Many songs talk about working hard but not getting rich or famous. Some songs are sad because life doesn't turn out as people hoped. For example, Glory Days is about people looking back at when they were young and had everything. Downbound Train tells the story of a man who loses his job and his life falls apart. It's easy to imagine that the singer is writing about real people he knows or what could have happened if he hadn't become famous. This album shows how talented the artist, known as the Boss, is.

Lewis wants to help protect the oceans more. He thinks we should make more areas safe for marine life. Right now, only 3% of the ocean is protected. Lewis wants this number to be 10%. This is important because humans are hurting the ocean. We're overfishing, polluting, and littering. Lewis has seen how bad things are when he goes on expeditions. He's swum in waters where coral reefs have died from getting too hot. He's also seen places with no life at all, just plastic and sand. Lewis thinks that if we give nature some space, it can get better. But time is running out. If we don't take care of our oceans, we might have a big problem soon. We need to start taking action now to protect the seas.

Terrie Sharp is a famous writer. She has won two awards for writing good stories. Terrie was born in a place with many problems in Glasgow. She learned to be quiet, not get into trouble and how to open car doors safely. But she only used this knowledge to write her books. Now, she talks more and appears on TV shows like Police Today and at writing events all over the UK.

Is everything getting worse? Can we really make progress? Steven Pinker thinks about how humans have improved things over time and finds some good news. We are living longer, healthier lives. People are also freer and happier. But there's a problem: people are not using reason and science like they used to. When leaders talk to people in ways that play on their emotions, we might hurt important things like democracy and working together as a world.

Old scary movies were different. When people were in trouble, they couldn't easily ask for help or call the police. This made the story more exciting. Now we have mobile phones, so it's not as believable. What can filmmakers do to make the story still suspenseful? They can say there is no phone signal! If you're a hero in a scary movie, you might be in trouble and need to call for help. But just when you try to call, you won't have any signal or your phone will run out of battery.

A long time ago, in the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America had a big problem. Their most valuable bananas, called Gros Michel or Big Mike, were dying out. Now, something similar is happening to the new type of banana that replaced it - Cavendish. The Gros Michel banana was very popular because its fruit was easy to transport, had thick skin and tasted sweet. Many banana farms in Central America grew this type of banana. United Fruit, a big company, grew bananas quickly and efficiently by copying plants from other plants instead of growing them from seeds. They grew the plants close together in fields.

Most spiders have venom that helps them catch their food. The venom doesn't usually hurt humans. Only 25 out of all spider species can really harm people, and even then it's rare for bites to be deadly. In Australia, there was a type of spider called the Sydney funnel-web spider that could be dangerous. But since they developed medicine to help in 1981, no one has died from its bite. Some spiders have long hairs on their bodies. If you bother them or make them feel scared, they might throw these hairs at you. The hairs can get stuck in your skin or eyes and feel very uncomfortable.

This type of scary movie is very common. It starts with friends having fun together. In the end, only one girl survives. At first, she is shy and not strong. But by the end, she becomes brave and clever. Usually, this last girl wins in the end.

To understand how we can speak complicated words, we need to look at our brains and compare them to other animals. This is not just about brain size; it's also important what else our brains can do. We don't have many clues from ancient times that tell us what language early humans used. But we can see something interesting in old human bones - the way their mouths, throats, and tongues developed over time. About 100,000 years ago, humans started making complex sounds. Before that, scientists are not sure if early humans only made simple sounds or not.

Society tells us that girls should like arts and humanities, not maths and physics. Boys are better at these things. This is a problem because there aren't many women who do science jobs that young people can look up to. Cartoons and stories usually show men as scientists, inventors, or astronauts. People think scientists are weird, don't have friends, and work alone. These ideas come from the media, but they're not true. They might make girls not want to be scientists. If there were more women who liked science, it would help girls feel good about themselves and like those subjects.

The Scallion newspaper comes out every week and is free for students in the university buildings. Many students read it - about 10,000! The paper is written and made by students themselves. People like to read it because it's fun, educational, and helps them learn new things. But printing newspapers costs a lot of money. Some students can't easily get a copy because they have to go to the university to pick one up. This also causes problems for the environment because many papers end up on the ground.

Girox Foods has some problems with people leaving their jobs. About 12 out of every 100 workers leave each year. This is more than usual in our industry, where only about 7 out of 100 workers usually leave. We want to find out why this is happening and give advice on how to make the workplace better for employees and keep them from leaving.

What the speaker said makes sense to me. I think it's true that when we're connected all the time, we can feel lonely. People my age didn't grow up with technology, so we know how to be alone and are comfortable with it. But younger people, under 20, have a different problem. They're always talking online, but they don't get used to being by themselves. This means they might not learn to enjoy their own company. Also, they're learning to talk through messages that can be changed, which is different from having real conversations with someone in front of you.

Don't always say something bad after saying something good. If you always mix good and bad comments, people might not listen to the good ones anymore. Sometimes just say something nice without adding anything else. Don't feel like you have to criticize too.

Your dreams can reveal surprising insights into things that were on your mind without you realizing it. You might have common dreams like flying or falling, losing your teeth or feeling embarrassed in public because you're not wearing any clothes. These kinds of dreams often mean similar things to most people. However, the secret to understanding what they really mean to you is to link them to the events and feelings that happened in your daily life.

Moscow has an unusual problem - there are around 35,000 wild dogs living on its streets. Some of these dogs were born in the city, while others were once pets that their owners abandoned. These dogs live alone or in groups. In 2010, scientists studied them and found out how well they've adapted to city life. They discovered that the dogs are very good at finding safe ways to cross the street with people. Some of them even seem to understand traffic lights!

Wonder is a novel by New Yorker RJ Palacio. She says on her website that she got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with a facial deformity walking down the street one day. Wonder has been very popular in the United States and has already won several awards. Many schools are using it to start discussions about bullying, friendship, and what it's like to be different from others. A movie version is being made, and many people, including me, are excitedly waiting to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. She knows that people often think rats are unusual pets, and she's lost count of how many times she's tried to explain to others that they're not dirty animals. If you take care of them properly, rats can make great pets. However, Chloe understands why some people might be surprised or even scared when they first meet her rats. She didn't like rats at first either - until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how friendly and smart they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided to adopt two of them.

Cape Town can be a challenging place for baboons. Sometimes, they get hurt or even killed in car accidents, and others get electrocuted while playing with electric cables. As baboons are an endangered species, the city council is taking steps to protect them and reduce conflicts between humans and baboons. To do this, they've hired a team of Baboon Monitors. These monitors' main job is to move baboons out of urban areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This approach has had some success, but it's proving tricky to keep baboons from coming back to the city once they realize it's an easy source of food.

I work for a big IT company that has its headquarters in the United States. Because of this, I do my job from home and use computers to communicate with colleagues. This means I don't have to spend time traveling or chatting with friends at the office. Instead, I focus on specific projects and can easily take breaks when my kids need me for school events or doctor's appointments. Having flexibility is really important to me because it allows me to balance work and family life. However, without set working hours, I sometimes find myself working late into the evening, even skipping dinner if there's a task that needs finishing.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular, but a new kind of art started to appear on streets all around the world. Some artists created art that tried to make people think about important issues like war, unfairness, and prejudice. They wanted to get people talking about these problems. Other street artists focused more on making their work look nice and attractive. In South America, many street artists went to poor areas and added color, energy, and beauty to the grey city walls that were once drab and uninteresting.

Every day, people see lots of things they can buy on social media, in magazines, and in shop windows. As a result, British shoppers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. With online shopping, it's easy to buy without giving it much thought. Many big brands make their clothes so cheap that customers can treat them like disposable items - wear them a few times and then throw them away.

Sam looked up at the big cloud of dust on the road, caused by Mr Carter's car driving to the Big House. The horses were swishing their tails and kicking out at flies, not paying attention to their owner coming back after a long time. Sam was waiting. Mr Carter only came outside when he had to, which suited Sam just fine. He liked it that way because it meant he could keep his job for longer. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The wet patches on his shirt were starting to dry and look like maps. His skin was getting red in the hot June sun. It looked like he had spent a lot of time indoors, probably making money while other people did the work.

In Berlin, Germany, many city residents were unhappy about people shooting pigs because they thought it was too cruel. This caused strong disagreements between hunters and animal lovers. The city council listened to their concerns and decided to take a different approach. Instead of allowing hunting, they built fences around the areas where pigs live and made it illegal to give them food. Only time will tell if this new plan works, but some people think it might be hard because warmer winters are making more pigs than before.

Suzanne Collins, the author of The Hunger Games, was inspired by classical Greek mythology when she wrote her book. As a child, one of her favorite stories was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens is controlled by Crete. However, the people of Athens rebel against their rulers. As punishment, King Minos forces the Athenians to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people are then thrown into a maze called the Labyrinth, where they are eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one of these youths, named Theseus, decides to fight the Minotaur and defeats it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a modern-day hero like Theseus.

Zoos can teach people about taking care of animals and their homes by bringing humans and animals together. This helps people understand why it's important to protect animals and their environments. Some zoos give a safe place for animals that were treated badly in circuses or pets that were left behind. These zoos also do important research on how animals behave and how to make them better if they're sick.

A new movement is gaining popularity as an alternative to consumerism - the 'buy nothing' trend. This idea started in Canada in the 1990s and then spread to the US, where people were tired of overspending on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day, people hold protests and cut up their credit cards to show they're against excessive spending. Throughout the year, groups that follow this movement organize events where people exchange or repair items they already own instead of buying new ones.

Some people think graffiti is art, while others see it as vandalism. The way you look at it depends on your perspective. In many countries, writing or painting on public property like buildings, buses, and trains is considered illegal and causes problems. Many street artists have been caught by the police and had to pay fines for their work. City councils are also unhappy because cleaning up graffiti can be very expensive.

The art world has started to appreciate graffiti and street art more recently. People think it's a valuable form of art. There have been big exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. For example, an American artist named Elura Emerald organized a street art show at a gallery in New York City in 2008. She said that artists who paint on the streets are just expressing themselves and not causing any harm to anyone else. They should be praised and celebrated for their creativity.

Most people have around four to six dreams every night when they're over ten years old. That means they have about 2,000 dreams per year! By the time someone reaches 80 years old, they might have had a total of 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget most of our dreams, which is probably true for around 95-99% of them, that still leaves us with a few thousand memories from all those dreams across our lifetime. It's not hard to believe that sometimes, something in a dream happens and then the same thing happens in real life too. This can happen especially if what we dreamed about is something that happens often in our daily lives.

The Hunger Games takes place in the future when North America was devastated. The story is set in a country called Panem, which consists of 12 poor districts controlled by the wealthy Capitol. The Capitol has complete power over the nation. Each district produces different things for the Capitol's benefit. District 12, where our story starts, is responsible for providing all the coal needed for the country. Interestingly, there used to be a 13th district, but they rebelled against the Capitol in the past and were destroyed as a result.

Wild animals sometimes enter cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are coming into residential areas near the city centre to eat. They open trash cans and take fruit from gardens and orchards. Some bold baboons have even gone into people's homes and taken food from kitchen shelves and refrigerators! Unfortunately, these baboons can be aggressive and have hurt many pet animals. As a result, many city residents don't want them around.

Many bridge construction accidents happen during the building process itself. These accidents often happen because of a mistake made by the engineers, like a wrong calculation. The bridge collapses under its own weight and this can be very dangerous for the workers on it at the time.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use the 17 stages of the hero's journey as inspiration for his stories. Usually, the hero begins by living an ordinary life, but something unexpected happens that sets them on a path of adventure and change. In Star Wars, Luke Skywalker starts off with a normal life, helping his aunt and uncle fix robots. But when he finds Princess Leia's message inside R2D2, it marks the beginning of his journey as a hero.

One idea to stop a big rock from hitting Earth is to use a powerful explosion to change its direction. This might sound like something out of a movie, but NASA actually proposed this plan in 1998. It's called HAMMER - Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response. The plan involves firing special rockets at the asteroid to try and knock it off course. If the rock is too close to Earth, these rockets would carry nuclear bombs that could blow it up.

When Campbell talks about heroes, he says that they usually start by saying no to an exciting adventure. But then someone wise and experienced comes along to help them make up their minds. This person encourages the hero to take the first step into a new world where amazing things happen. Next, the hero faces challenges like tests and battles with bad guys. They also meet people who become friends and help them on their journey. As they get ready for the biggest challenge of all, they learn from these friends and prepare themselves. In Luke's story, his wise friend is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO, and the bad guy is Darth Vader inside the Death Star, which is like a special world.

Some things we don't use might seem useless to us, but they could be really useful to someone else. With the internet, people have found ways to make money by sharing these underused items with others. Now, websites and social media groups that help people buy and sell second-hand goods make it easy for friends to share things with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that our dreams show us things we're not aware of in our waking lives. This idea says that if we understand what our dreams are telling us, we can figure out why we feel certain ways or have problems. On the other hand, some people believed that dreams are just a mix of random thoughts and memories from the day, which our brains process while we're sleeping. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these jumbled images and feelings by turning them into a story.

As a freelancer, I'm my own boss. This is really great because I get to decide what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was tough to focus. There were too many things distracting me: household chores that needed doing, wanting another cup of tea, family members asking for attention. So, I started going to a nearby café to work, but the internet connection wasn't great and I ended up drinking too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a shared office space with five other freelancers like me. I liked getting dressed to go to work every morning and being able to focus in an office environment.

NASA's next step will be to find the smaller asteroids that are left. To do this, they need to get funding for a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope would use infrared light to spot the asteroids. If they get the money, it might take them about 10 years to complete their task. Once they've found all the asteroids, the team in charge of defending our planet will have to figure out how to protect us from the really big and scary ones that could cause damage.

The 'buy nothing' trend has become popular even among social media influencers who usually share products and beauty tips with their followers. Some YouTube stars now suggest that people don't buy anything for a year or more. Two friends in Canada decided to take this challenge seriously and spent a whole year only buying food. At first, they learned how to live without buying things like electronics, clothes, or household items for three months. Then, they gave up services like haircuts, eating out at restaurants, and filling up their car's gas tank. After just one year, they had saved an impressive $55,000.

Pi thinks religion is very important. Although his family follows Hinduism, he's interested in other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. People are surprised when Pi says he believes in all three - Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity - at the same time! When his family and teachers ask him to pick just one, Pi refuses, saying 'I just want to love God'. After that, they decide to let him make up his own mind about religion.

Some people believe that writing down your dreams can help you become more aware of your thoughts while you're dreaming. This type of dreaming, called lucid dreaming, means you know you're dreaming and can make choices to change what's happening in your dream. For example, if you have a scary nightmare, you might be able to turn it into a peaceful one. Or, you could control the story of your dream like a movie director. Instead of just trying to figure out what your dreams mean, you'll actually be creating them yourself. However, it's also nice to have some dreams where your subconscious can share its thoughts with you.

Many people might not think about the problem with disposable clothing because they donate their old clothes to charity. However, charity shops often struggle to sell all these donated items. Fast fashion is a big issue because it quickly goes out of style and is usually too cheaply made to be recycled. People don't want to buy second-hand clothes that are in poor condition. As a result, huge amounts of clothing end up being thrown away. Some of the clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, which creates even more economic and environmental problems.

Some people who love adventure don't stop after one exciting trip. Meagan McGrath from Canada is an example of this. She has climbed the highest mountains on each continent, rode a bike across her own country, and even run a long-distance race in the hot Sahara Desert. But what's really impressive is when she went skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she accidentally fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many of us would probably give up at that point, but Meagan didn't. She decided to keep going and reached the South Pole after 40 days. During this time, she pulled a heavy sledge with her tent and food behind her through freezing temperatures and icy storms.

Blek le Rat began by painting rats on the walls of his hometown, Paris. Now, he wants to make people think about important social issues and problems. One example is his paintings of homeless people in big cities. He hopes that these pictures will encourage city residents to consider the issue of homelessness.

In certain parts of the world, local governments have tried to help artists by giving them special places to create street art without causing trouble. For example, Taiwan has designated areas called 'graffiti zones' where artists can freely paint and write on walls. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has even allowed some talented graffiti artists to decorate the subway trains with their work.

Faith47 comes from Cape Town in South Africa. She creates big, colorful paintings of people and animals. She enjoys exploring different places to find inspiration for her art. Her work can be seen on pavements, in old factories that are no longer used, and even on abandoned cars. Faith47 likes that most street art is temporary - it might get washed away by rain or cleaned up by the city council soon. For her, this shows how life is always changing, with things ending and new things starting all the time.

In her old job, Gabriela was used to a workplace where people respected those in charge and everyone knew their role. In this kind of culture, bosses make important decisions and aren't often questioned. But Gabriela's Swedish team worked differently. They were used to working together with their leaders to solve problems and make choices. Here, leaders acted like coaches or mentors who encouraged people to think for themselves and expected them to question things.

When Gabriela noticed some cultural differences between herself and her team, she decided to have a chat with them about their feelings towards her leadership. Her team was happy to share their thoughts, and they told her that they were used to having more freedom to make decisions and take initiative. They felt uncomfortable when Gabriela told them exactly what to do, as it made them feel like she didn't trust them to get the job done properly. The team also explained that when they tried to suggest changes or challenge Gabriela's ideas, she took it personally, which wasn't their usual way of working.

Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo, Brazil. They're famous for painting all sorts of things, from small tags on walls to huge, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Sometimes their paintings are so big that they need special machines called cranes to help them finish the job. One year, in 2007, they even painted an entire castle in Scotland - it was a massive project!

For thousands of years, people have been writing and painting on walls. In ancient times, people in Africa and Europe would paint pictures of animals and people inside caves. Archaeologists have also discovered graffiti on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In a town called Pompeii, which was buried under ash when Mount Vesuvius erupted, archaeologists found many examples of writing on walls. These messages were written in Latin and include things like prayers, political statements, love notes, and even some magic spells!

Have you ever imagined climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? Many people have this dream. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the highest mountains or walk across countries. They use modern tools like GPS and satellite phones to help them on their journeys. Some adventurers love nature and use their travels to tell others about important environmental issues. Others want to help people in need and raise money for good causes.

The first mission is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. The plan is to test DART on the smaller moon of an asteroid called Didymos. This small moon, known as 'Didymoon', is about 150 metres wide and orbits around its larger parent asteroid, which is approximately 800 metres in diameter. If everything goes well, the impact of DART should be strong enough to knock Didymoon out of its orbit, making it visible from Earth-based telescopes.

The main character in this story is a 16-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. She lives in District 12, where she has to work hard to help her family survive after her father died in a mining accident. To make ends meet, Katniss goes hunting with her friend Gale in the woods around their district. She becomes very good at using a bow and arrow. When her little sister Prim is chosen to participate in the Hunger Games, Katniss decides to take her place instead. The other person from District 12 who has to play the game is a boy named Peeta. As they spend more time together, Katniss finds herself in a complicated situation with him.

When you write about your dreams, you might find that you remember more details about them. Think about the people and places in your dream - they could help you understand what it means. After just one week, you'll be amazed at how much you've written down! Once you have all these notes, you can start to see connections between your dreams and what happens in your daily life.

In the past, many bridges were made of wood. This was a problem because they were more likely to catch on fire. Old-fashioned train bridges were especially vulnerable. When trains passed over these bridges, the sparks from the steel wheels and tracks could sometimes ignite the wooden structure, causing it to burn down.

Street art is changing and evolving all the time. While many young artists still create their work in their own city or neighborhood, more and more are traveling and working with other artists from around the world. The internet has also become a big part of street art, allowing artists to share their work and connect with each other online. Additionally, the art world is starting to recognize street art as a legitimate form of artistic expression. While it's hard to predict exactly what will happen to street art in the future, one thing is certain - it's here to stay!

Suzanne Collines has always been bothered by news programs about wars. When she was a kid, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam. Her mom tried to keep her safe by not telling her what was happening during the war, but Suzanne still saw news reports about it on TV. She knew her dad was there because of all the stories and pictures she saw. It was a really scary experience for her.

A recent survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) gathered responses from over 40,000 people, including those born between 1983 and 1993. The survey asked about workplace culture, how people communicate with each other, and different work styles. It also looked at pay structures, opportunities for career growth, balancing work and personal life, and more. In another global survey by Deloitte, over 10,000 millennials took part in a study about their views on the challenges and possibilities of working in today's complex job market.

Erik Weihenmayer is an American adventurer who loves trying new things. He has gone on exciting journeys, like cycling through the deserts in Morocco and kayaking down the Grand Canyon. What's even more impressive is that Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. When he's not traveling, Erik tries to inspire people with disabilities to stay active and healthy. He also takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips, showing them that they can do amazing things too.

Online platforms are making it easy for people to make some extra money. For instance, busy parents who used to think twice about selling their kids' old things at a market or car boot sale can now use online marketplaces to get rid of gently used baby clothes and expensive strollers that their children have outgrown. This way, they can put some cash back in their pockets.

Pi and Richard Parker are on a lifeboat for 227 days. They face many challenges like hunger, sickness, and exhaustion. Strong storms and scorching hot sun also test their endurance. Despite all this, they manage to stay alive. Sometimes Pi finds comfort in his three religions, but at other times he feels very lonely and sad. When the Mexican coast finally comes into view, everything changes. I won't give away what happens next - you'll have to read the book yourself to find out what happens when Pi and Richard Parker see land again!

Chloe got home from school and made herself a cup of coffee. Then, she went up to her bedroom to relax for a bit. She had some homework to do, but she decided to put it off for now. Instead, she wanted to enjoy the quiet hour before her parents came home. This was her favorite time of day because there were no distractions - just peace and quiet. She loved this time because she could play with her pet rats without anyone bothering her.

In 2010, scientists at NASA looked at and recorded almost all the big asteroids near Earth. These asteroids, called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs, are as tall as mountains. They're anything that's within a distance of about 50 million kilometers from where our planet orbits around the sun. After counting them, NASA found that none of the 887 they know about are a threat to Earth.

Auggie decides to go to school, but then he has to face his first day. Like most kids starting at a new school, he's very nervous. But because of how he looks, it's a really tough experience for him. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he notices other kids staring at him or talking about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes friends with Jack from his class and Summer, who he talks to at lunch. However, the first day isn't the only hard part. Auggie soon finds out that his classmates don't want to touch him because they're afraid of getting sick. Throughout the school year, Auggie goes through many ups and downs until something unexpected happens at a school camp that changes everything.

The two men looked towards the north part of the property. It went on forever, as far as you could see. Even the fences were hard to spot from where they stood. You might think a teenager would get bored and want to escape, but it's not easy to do that on foot. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking its heavy hooves against the ground. Could the boy ride? he wondered. There are plenty of problems you can get into if you're good with horses and out here all alone. But maybe there are even more troubles for someone who knows nothing about horses and wants to get away from his father.

Every year, over 4,000 people of all ages, from teenagers to seniors, reach the top of Mount Everest. Despite the risks involved with climbing high mountains in freezing temperatures and strong storms, the world's top climbers are now looking for new adventures. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, an Austrian climber, fell in love with mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After finishing school, she became a nurse, but continued to climb in her spare time.

Gerlinde, who had already climbed Mount Everest, decided to tackle all 14 of the world's highest peaks that are over 8,000 meters tall. To make it even more challenging, she climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is a bit risky because high mountains can have very low levels of oxygen, which can affect how well your brain and body work. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to help raise money for a charity that supports poor children and orphans in Nepal.

When we take a look around our homes, it's likely that we'll notice some things we own aren't being used very much. For example, maybe you have a thick woolly coat that you thought was fashionable when you bought it, but since you live in a warm place, you hardly wear it. Or perhaps you have an old smartphone that you stopped using after buying a new one. Maybe your car only gets driven on weekends or holidays, so most of the time it's just sitting there. And then there might be a spare room in your house that has become more like a storage space than a place for guests to stay.

For centuries, dreams have been linked to predicting the future. Many cultures believed that dreams were messages from a higher power, sent to help us understand something or gain insight. Even now, lots of people can remember a time when they had a dream about someone or something, and then it actually happened in real life later on.

Building bridges is a massive undertaking that requires a lot of money and effort. These structures are vital because they allow cars, trucks, and trains to cross rivers, valleys, or other roads. As a result, bridge-building is a crucial part of civil engineering, and people pay close attention when something goes wrong, especially if a bridge collapses.

Gabriela had been struggling for weeks, so she decided to email her Swedish boss about the problems she was having with her team. Her manager just asked her if everything was okay and what she thought would help her work better with her colleagues. Gabriela felt that her manager wasn't taking the situation seriously enough and didn't think he was doing a good job of fixing the issues.

Dogs that live together in groups have figured out that humans are more likely to give food to smaller and cuter dogs. So, these dogs are sent to ask for food on behalf of the whole group. Some clever dogs have even learned how to use the city's metro system to travel between different parts of their territory! Scientists aren't sure exactly how they know when to get off the train, but one idea is that they use their great sense of smell and recognize the smells of their favorite places. Another possibility is that they've learned to recognize the names of stations from announcements on the train. Whatever way they do it, people who travel by metro have gotten used to seeing dogs on the trains, so they don't usually notice them anymore.

Ed Stafford from England is an adventurer who has done something amazing. He walked along the Amazon River from its source in the Andes mountains of Peru to its mouth in Brazil. It took him two years and four months, covering a distance of 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest is full of dangers like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars. Ed had to be very careful all the time. Despite the risks, he managed to survive without any serious injuries. He just got bitten by some mosquitoes and ants a few thousand times!

In the UK, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year, which is about four per cent of their income. This might not seem like much, but there are two concerning trends that affect society and the environment. Firstly, many people buy things using credit cards. On average, adults in Britain owe around £670 to these companies. That's almost two-thirds of what they spend on new clothes each year. Secondly, people are not only spending money they don't have, but also buying things they don't really need. As a result, the UK throws away 300,000 tons of clothing every year, most of which ends up in landfills.

Ed's journey through the rainforest would have been very hard without modern technology. He used a radio to ask people living there if he could take food from them and cross their land. Many of these people came to meet him and helped guide him through the toughest parts of his trip. As he walked, Ed wrote about his daily experiences on a blog. He used the attention his journey received in the media to speak out against the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for charities that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.

Many companies are now taking advantage of the sharing economy because it can be very profitable. One popular business model is when a company creates an online platform that connects customers with people who have something to offer, like a product or service. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their empty rooms and houses to tourists, making extra money from their spare space. Another example is Uber, which allows people to use their own cars as taxis and earn some extra cash in their free time.

Zoos play a crucial role in helping endangered species survive. In the wild, some of these species struggle to find mates and have babies because there aren't many of them left. They might also face threats from poachers, losing their homes, or being eaten by predators. A good zoo provides a safe space for these animals to live and breed. This is especially important when some wild populations are getting smaller. As this happens, the risk increases that the remaining animals will all be very similar genetically. Breeding programs in zoos help prevent this: they can release zoo-born animals back into the wild to mix things up genetically.

Bridges collapsing is a rare occurrence, but it can happen in different ways. When trains are involved, it's usually because they hit the bridge too hard. With boats, even if they're moving slowly, their great size and weight can cause the bridge to collapse. To prevent these disasters from happening, we need to plan ahead. Modern technologies that check for weaknesses, safer working conditions, and better designs can all help reduce the risk of accidents like this.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals on the boat and jumps into the ocean to get away from them. But then he remembers that there are sharks swimming around him, looking for food. He quickly realizes that his only choice is to climb back onto the lifeboat. As time passes, the animals in the boat start eating each other one by one until only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger, which he names Richard Parker, is feeling sick from the sea and doesn't want to eat him right away.

When Pi was 16, his parents didn't like the new government that was elected. They were worried about what would happen next. To be safe, they decided to close the zoo and move to Canada. Some animals went to other zoos in North America, but some came with them on a big ship. On the way, there was a really bad storm. The ship sank, and sadly, Pi's family and all the sailors died. But Pi found himself alone in a small boat with a hyena, zebra, orangutan, and an enormous tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book written by American author Suzanne Collins for teenagers and young adults. Since it was published in 2008, it has been translated into many languages - 26 to be exact! It has also sold millions of copies all around the world. What's more, it's the first book for young readers to sell over a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is now a big Hollywood movie too, and it's just as successful. In fact, when it opened in North America, it made an impressive 152.5 million dollars!

When we sleep, our brains process the thoughts and ideas from the day in a special way. It seems like our mind takes all these thoughts and turns them into dreams with hidden meanings. During the day, our thoughts are like conversations we have with ourselves - words and sentences that make sense. But when we're asleep, something changes. The part of our brain that helps us talk and think clearly becomes quieter, while the part that deals with emotions gets stronger. This is why our dreams can be so vivid and emotional, even though they might not always make logical sense.

Having good relationships is crucial for being happy. Research shows that most happy people have strong bonds with their friends and family, and they make time to see them regularly. It's also important to have someone you can talk openly with - this is called 'self-disclosure'. Just one person who understands you deeply is enough, along with a network of other relationships. Having lots of friends just for doing things or chatting about music or football isn't enough. What matters most is that deeper connection. Some people need to learn how to listen well to others in order to build stronger relationships.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist who believes in developing our potential, says that our brains are flexible and can learn new things. Many people praise others for their natural abilities or final results, like 'You're really good with details' or 'You're great at organizing events'.
